result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra A Mazoch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.
PROBATION REVIEW HEARING December 11, 2015 at 1:15 P.m. in Br. 38.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
If defendant complies with all terms and conditions of probation, the Court will authorize expungement under 973.015.

Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Parenting classes.  Supervise children.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra A Mazoch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cassandra A Mazoch not in court.  Elizabeth N Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from CMC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  5-13-2016 review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Cassandra A Mazoch in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
At request of Probation agent Mary Brandl, due to BMCW case, review hearing is changed to 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm.

Defendant Cassandra A Mazoch in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 40.
Sentencing as to count 1 proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 83 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months, concurrent.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.  Parenting classes.  Supervise children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay all costs.
-No firearms; weapons.
IF DEFENDANT COMPLIES WITH ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF PROBATION THE COURT WILL AUTHORIZE EXPUNGEMENT UNDER 973.015.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.

Defendant Cassandra A Mazoch in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cassandra A Mazoch in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Defendant would like to enter a plea.  Due to court calendar, matter cannot be heard.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Cassandra A Mazoch not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Defendant wanted to enter a plea but court is in trial.  Court will hear the plea and sentencing on day of trial, 7/15/15.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Cassandra A Mazoch not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court via telephone, defendant Cassandra A Mazoch not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.  Attorney Shelton is ill and could not appear.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.M. (3/27/13) AND K.M. (3/15/11) ONLY AS PERMITTED BY THE BMCW.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Cassandra A Mazoch in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Cassandra A Mazoch in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
